Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: oktravelchick
Reviews.Content: For the same price that we could have got two hotel rooms, we booked this 2-bedroom condo and wound up getting the unit in the "Royal Links" section, which is across the road from the golf course off Wildwood. If we were to live in Branson, I would buy this condo in a second! A full giant sized kitchen, large dining table (seats 6), living room, balcony, 2 bedrooms with king sized beds, 2 baths - 1 large master bath with 2 person jetted tub, wi-fi internet, and all the extras. It is also designer decorated - ours had a safari type of theme. The balcony looked over the golf course, and all was very quiet - very unlike a hotel and more like a home! I can't say enough about this place. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: vilynsia m
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying in the condos. Building 3 and now bldg 6. Both are very clean, everything you need is in the condo. Don't stay in bldg 8 the first floor looks into buildings instead of the golf course.

Reviews.Title: “really good rates”
Reviews.Author: Travis H
Reviews.Content: the condos are really great, best stay in Branson. really great accommodation there were a lot of nice people working there who were really helpful and it's in a great location to be in branson. way better than the marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Log cabins are great!”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2br/2bath loft log cabin. When we first drove up to our unit, I was a little disappointed because I wanted to feel like I was in the woods. I was wrong! Once we walked in and looked off the screened porch, we were in the woods enough for me! The decor was nice and in great condition. The king beds were comfy. The bathrooms were super nice and clean. The kitchen had everything we could ask for. The location was excellent. Less than 2 minutes to the main strip and outlet shopping. It was a little pricey, but the experience was nice and we will return. I love the log cabins! Great job Thousand Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Family weekend get-together”
Reviews.Author: Cattleman007
Reviews.Content: A family get-away let us see different rooms at the resort. We had a king-condo, which was tastefully decorated and comfortable. Others has the queen-condo, which was kind of small and dark. A third rented the three bedroom condo. You are at the mercy of the owner when it comes to interior decor. All were clean, and expensive. Other than golf and pools, there is little in the way of resort type of activities. Nothing for the kids other than the pools. Nice for adults but a challenge for families with little ones.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT cabins, average resort amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jonricha
Reviews.Content: Our group had 3 of the four-bedroom cabins for a family reunion. The four-bedroom cabins are made up of two bedroom cabins with a connecting door in between. So, you can open the middle door and have two kitchens, two living rooms, and two patios. Alot of room to spread out for a large group like ours. The ceilings are high and the rooms are large, so it feels really big. The cabins are in excellent condition and well stocked with all the kitchen supplies and appliances you would need. We had a few mechanical issues: hot water, lights, sticking door, but maintenance came within 30 minutes and fixed everything right away. The only downside was the "resort" part. The cabins are across a busy street from the main resort. There is a small pool for the cabins, but that was about it. Choose the cabins if you want a spacious place for a group to hang out, not for the resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A Skeptic Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: A desperate last minute phone call led us to stay at the Lakeview Condos - Majestic, a part of Thousand Hills properties. With 3 teens (2 girls and 1 boy) we needed a 2-3 bedroom. I am a frequent business traveler and was determined to get something new, modern and well appointed. I was very afraid of a condo with hand-me-down furniture, etc. I refused to stay anywhere near the strip, and this was situated on a hill near the lake. Well, I heartily recommend the Majestic property by Thousand Hills. The furnishings were first class and new, and the property had terrific views of Table Rock. All 5 of us had plenty of room in the 3 bdrm/3 ba condo...a king bed in each room. I was also pleasantly surprised by the check in experience and staff, well done!

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay and Resort.”
Reviews.Author: inhoclupo
Reviews.Content: We rented two connecting cabins for a family vacation in md July. We had 5 families with kids and had 4 bedrooms and 1 loft. The resort was located in the middle of the strip next to the outlet malls, restaurants, activities. The cabins are nice but are pourley layed out. The cabins are fairly modern but were not very clean. The biggest issue we had was all of the bathrooms were located in the bedrooms. If you had to use the bathroom you had to go into someone else's room. So the couple sleeping in the loft did not have a bathroom to use in the middle of the night without walking through someone's bedroom. The pool was clean but was very small and probably could accommodate 20 people comfortably. For the amount of cabins at the resort two cabins could crowd the pool. The other issue was a barbecue pit that you would find at a park that was suppose to be used by 4-5 cabins. Overall the resort was average not Great and not Bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accommodations in Branson”
Reviews.Author: berrybuzz
Reviews.Content: We took our family vacation in Branson, and since there were seven of us, we wanted a place to spread out rather than cramming into a couple hotel rooms. We got a 3 bedroom condo at Thousand Hills Resort and it blew us away. Not only did it have 3 bedrooms, but also 3 bathrooms which made it tremendously easy to get ready each morning and to clean up each day after having fun around town. The best surprise was the sun room which could be accessed from the living room or the master bedroom. We took our parents, who are early risers, so they could sit in the sun room, enjoy some coffee and watch morning TV without disturbing the rest of us who were sleeping a little later. (after all it was a vacation) Thousand Hills is in a great location and very convenient to all of the major attractions including Silver Dollar City, White Water, Branson Landing, and Sight and Sound Theater. High recommendation to anyone planning a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo”
Reviews.Author: Barb C
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Thousand Hills with our son and daughter-in-law. This time we stayed at the "Foothills" which was extremely nice. Both bedrooms had king beds, and we were able to make the bathroom for the second bedroom private by closing the hall door. We could see the pool from the patio. The unit was clean, and a lot of supplies are provided which makes packing for the trip easier. This year we had our 1 year old granddaughter with us, and she enjoyed having so much room to run around. Thousand Hills is great for two families (or more).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Cabin”
Reviews.Author: NRL11_11_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two-bedroom cabin with loft over Memorial Day weekend in order to qualify for the "Platinum package" which included certain show tickets. Upon walking in, all we could manage to say was, "Wow". It was awesome! We had a beautifully decorated cabin, complete with a stone fireplace on a propane timer. One bathroom had a jacuzzi tub. Another had dual shower heads, but one did not work at all. It was spotless. The cabin we received had log beds and furniture, but from my understanding, not all are this way. There was a full kitchen including a dishwasher and washer and dryer! And an enclosed porch. There were plenty of fluffy towels and the soap scent reminded us of lilies of the valley. One thing we did not like was the personalized plaque on the exterior exclaiming, "The Smiths, Robert and Jan, Established 2007". This was a buzz-killer. Also, someone parked in the spot right outside our door. May I suggest assigned parking? Also, although it does not indicate on their website, many of a cabins are duplexes, not individual cabins. It could've been quieter if our neighbor hadn't brought their dog. Also, on their website, the platinum package does not indicate you will only receive ONE ticket to certain shows. Most people do not travel to Branson alone, so of course we bought additional tickets. Overall, this was a wonderful place and you'll pay for it. But it is so nice we'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place with awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay N
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 Bedroom Condo and it had a full kitchen, dinning room, and living room. It also had a beautiful view of the golf course. If we travel back to Branson we would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service/nice view/condo--BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: Derekdj
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay same place @ the Majestic four bedroom condo. The 1st time we all were WOWED with the view but that was about it. The 2nd time we assumed things would get better but we were wrong. As much as we spend getting this trip together and preparing you would think the Hills would be flexiable. We had a major issue where our fridge went out on day 1 and they failed to do anything but give us 1 cooler and 1 bag of ice, after we told them we bought over $200 worth of food and most needed to be refrigerated. I mean we understand things happen and there are certain things that certain people cant do. As we left the gave us 2 bags of cookies and said someone will reach out to us about our issue. One week went by, one month went by and no call. So we decided to call because maybe they forget. NOTHING AT ALL. FINALLY two days ago we got a call from the GM of the property after we left a VM 3 days before. THIS lady said in the rudest way possible what is it that you want US to do things happen now when would like for us to book your next reservation. Are you serious we spent thousands of dollars and thats it.WE WILL NEVER GO AGAIN I SUGGEST ANYONE ELSE WHO VAULE THERE MONEY AND WHO WANTS TO PAY FOR WHAT THEY GET--GO ANYWHERE ELSE OR ELSE, YOU WILL BE NEXT.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Thousand Hills”
Reviews.Author: Kasey926
Reviews.Content: We stayed at these cabins in September of 2011. There were 8 adults and 2 children and we rented the duplex. It was just perfect for us, we kept the door open between the two so that everyone was able to go from one cabin to the other. The guys went golfing and the ladies went shopping. The cabins are close to shopping, restaurants and attractions, the location was perfect for us. We were able to prepare meals and enjoy the screened in balcony while having a glass of wine. Very relaxing place. Will definitely stay there again. The only thing there was no a grill on the property, so we were not able to cookout. So now we know to just pack the grill next time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Angela T
Reviews.Content: We fortunate enough to stay a few days and everything was wonderful! The room was so spacious, clean, and comfortable. The master bedroom and bath were spacious and beautiful. The main living area was open to the kitchen. I could cook and still take part in the family fun. We ate several meals on the large balcony. It had everything we needed including our own washer and dryer (laundry soap too)! Our children had a great time at the pool and on the tennis court. After long hot days at Silver Dollar City, we were all happy to come back to our nice home at Thousand Hills Resort. We can't wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Cabins are FANTASTIC!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SliverQueen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at these cabins twice now, and it will be our place future stay anytime we are in Branson. The cabins are very roomy, and loaded with everything you could possibly want. They are very clean and have nice quality furniture/applicances in them. The full kitchen is a delight. They are located right in the middle of town, but you would never know it. Very quiet location! The staff is very friendly and courteous. They are a bit pricey, but completely worth it. Love love love this place and it's now our new "go-to!"

Reviews.Title: “Awsome stay”
Reviews.Author: LJohnson_11
Reviews.Content: Our stay was awesome. I've stayed there before for a business conference and that made me want to return. I will definitely go again! Great golfcourse.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful propery”
Reviews.Author: Enid_OKDonnaevans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one bedroom condo Oct. 21 and 22 at the Tuscany. It was very nice and comfortable. Beds are very comfortable. Very spaceous. Didn't cook in it but could have. Like the location, it is centrally located to most all things.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!!!”
Reviews.Author: michelle0112
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a condo from September 22, 2011 to September 25, 2011. We stayed in a condo here years ago then switched to their cabins and we loved it. The condo has everything you need and more. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and was spaceous even for 6 people. We were close to every place we wanted to go. The condos are very clean and kept up to date. The staff is wonderful and will help you with anything that you need. We will be staying there again the next time we go up. Right out the back patio was the pool and a basketball court for the kids. We had a nice view of the golf course. Thank you Thousand Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: gladys40
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our condo rental at Thousand Hills Resort. It was clean, spacious, and even had a washer and dryer, which I find really helpful when travelling. It was convenient to everything in Branson but not on the main drag, even close to the grocery store. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have never booked.”
Reviews.Author: djlebc1
Reviews.Content: On April 24th, I made an online reservation for Thousand Hills. They had a special if you booked a condo for 7 days you received a 35% discount off the room rate. I reserved a 1 bedroom condo and the reservation went through no problem. I was happy with the room and the rate. Later that afternoon, I received a phone call from Thousand Hills stating that they did not have any 1 BR condo available for the entire week I would be in Branson. At the time the TH representative said he would upgrade me to a 2 bedroom at the same price. Later that day I received an e-mail confirmation with the price I was quoted plus the room type as 2 BR Condo. I was very happy that I would have more room, I allowed my son to invite a friend along for the trip. All was set. 4 days before heading to TH, I called to make sure that my request for being close to a pool was noted on my reservation. At that time ( 4 days before my arrival and 3 months after my reservation ) I was informed that I was back to a 1 BR condo at the original price. I at no time was notified by Thousand Hills of the down grade. I had added more people to the reservation so a 1 BR would no longer work for us. I asked to speak with a manager. I was given to a mgr ( I believe her name was CiCi ) and explained the situation. She claimed that policy was if my original reservation opened up, they downgrade anyone that had been upgraded and since they now had a large group coming in, They needed the larger condo for them. I was not happy, since I had NO communication with TH between April and July other than them trying to sell me show tickets. No where in the fine print of the reservation confirmation does it say anything about possible downgrade after and upgrade. It speaks of cancellation only. Many times while on the phone with CiCi, I was rudely reminded that I had what I originally reserved, and I explained to her that once I received my upgrade information, we invited more kids along. I was not happy with her tone, so I asked to speak with her manager. I was then given to Ginger. I Explained once again what had happened. She told me that I should have been told about the downgrade if they need the units. But since I was not, give her a few moments to see what she could find. One of the groups only needed a 1 bedroom now, she had just received their final list so I was lucky and she could give me the 2 BR. I was very happy at that point and was looking forward to checking in on Monday. I have stayed at TH before on 2 occasions with groups so I know how nice the condos can be. When I checked in I had asked to be in a certain area that is close to a pool, basketball courts and other kid activities, there is also grass that the kids could run around and throw a ball. The condo I was given, was nothing like that. It was way around in the wooded area with no grass area, very small pool (because of the heat had algae in it) and I believe the oldest buildings that TH has. When we arrived at the room there was caution tape up on cones for some cement work that was going on. When we walked into the condo, the first odor that came and hit us in the face was Smoke. I am not a smoker and have allergies as well as my kids. I knew this would not work so I picked up the phone and called the lobby. The first person I speak to is CiCi ( again with a rude tone ) telling me there is nothing else. It was only 2pm in the afternoon, you can not tell me that everyone had checked in. I asked for her supervisor and was given to Ginger again. She also told me they had nothing because they had to keep groups together and if they moved me then someone else would be unhappy! They could bring an ionizer machine over to help with the smell. Nothing I said was going to change my location. I tried to find a new hotel in the area, but since there was a softball tournament in town plus dance groups too, I was not able to locate anything within the price range I had to keep. I let them bring the machine and it sounded like a large, loud tornado fan. So we sat the first night with the machine on and tv blasting. It did not help with the smoke smell at all. I asked the next day to move but of course was told no. I went to the outlets and purchased some air fresheners to help with the smell. It did not get rid of it but it covered it a little bit. I had to double up on the allergy medicine to not be all stuffy. The "golf" view from our condo was completely covered in overgrown trees. The furniture and decor is very outdated compared to other units I have stayed in. The bed in the master bedroom was not attached to the head board correctly so when I rolled over or moved it made loud noises. The toilet seat was broken, The second toilet ran water all the time. Because I was staying for a week, I was to have a mid week cleaning and sheet change. That never happened. When I checked out, I mentioned the cleaning to them and they told me I should have called. I had ruined the 1st night of my trip being frustrated with the unit, I was not going to make any more phone calls and ruin the rest of my trip. We decided to leave a day early since at that point all of our allergies were terrible from the smoke smell. When I checked out, I was informed that since I was leaving a day early that I would no longer have the 35% discount it would be down to 30%. Just one more little thing to rub in my face. I should have given them the $20 receipt for the air fresheners, but at that point I already knew I would never stay there again or recommend them to friends. It was all about the money and I was only 1 guest, not a large group. To top it off, on Thursday of our week stay, we had what I would have thought were elephants move in above us. They were loud from 7 am to midnight every day. On 2 mornings at 8 am, I received phone calls that would wake us up wanting to speak to the owner! By the 2nd day I got smart and unplugged the phones. There are plenty of hotels in Branson so I suggest you look around for some better deals. I would have paid a little bit more to not have a stressful week, but it was too late once we got there.

Reviews.Title: “5th year in a row”
Reviews.Author: CJtravelerDenver
Reviews.Content: We stay here every summer while picking our kids up from summer camp. Every year we have stayed in a different building, and have had a great experience each time. It has always been quiet and relaxing. We also usually play a round of golf at the golf course. I've never had any issues. I think most of the units (maybe all) have a washer/dryer which is helpful for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Thousand Hills Golf Resort "Awesome"”
Reviews.Author: cassiecamp
Reviews.Content: We had a basketball tournament July 8th-July 10th in Branson Mo. We decided to give Thousand Hills Golf Resort a try. I had to book for 12 families and we reserved 2 bedroom condos, King Suites, and Queen Suites. I was very pleased with all of the accomodations. Our condos were equipped with all of the amenities of home. The decor was modern and very pretty. The beds were comfortable and we enjoyed having the DVD player in the living room. The children loved the basketball court and the outdoor pool. We didn't get a chance to enjoy the inside pool. The property was located just far enough from the main street and it didn't take us long to get to our gyms. Everyone that helped check us in were friendly and very helpful. We loved the freshly baked cookies at check-out. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: IamthemanIam
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent value; however, at $200/night I think the following need to be adressed: 1) front desk staff had the worst attitudes and were not helpful. 2)Grand Legacy property needs an outdoor pool. 3) Grand Legacy needs better grilling accomadations. They have 2 tiny grills for 100 units and they were literally stuck in a hole in the ground without any tables, chairs or shade in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Arkansas101
Reviews.Content: We loved the Thousand Hills Resort! This was our first time to stay at this resort and we will stay again. The bed was comfy and loved the small kitchen in the room, great for drinks and snacks. Hope to take our family back and rent one of Thousand Hills cabin this summer:)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Mimaboy
Reviews.Content: Rented a 3 bedroom/3bath condo at Royal Links. It's fully furnished with everything, absolutely everything you could need in a home other than a corkscrew.LOL! Very comfortable and nicely decorated in a country style. Plenty of towels, dishes, washer/dryer stack unit, this kitchen is bigger than mine back home. Great location at the golf course, it's quiet in spite of this area is literally hundreds of condos next to condos, stacked on top of other condos, condos under us, condos everywhere. Only drawback is the exercise facility is half a mile away, not a problem for us runners but definitely an issue for anyway who cannot easily walk the hills in and around Branson. Exercise facility is nicely appointed, it's not Gold Gym but it's also not the usual just a treadmill and step climber either. It will do nicely for a vacation and keep you in shape or just working off the endless buffets you probably have been eating at. The indoor pool is in a building across from the exercise facility. Hot tub was in the same location as was our condo rental but closed now for the winter. Other than being really spread out, this is a great value for the money. We were very comfortable, could fix our own meals, each had their own bedroom and bath, every room had it's own TV, free WiFi, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pices
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 bedroom cabin with spouse and another couple. The cabin was very comfortable, professionally decorated, and had everything needed to make our stay pleasant. We enjoyed our cocktails each evening on the back porch before dining out. The cabins are located in a wooded area close to everything; yet it was very quiet. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “just bring yourself, everything else is provided”
Reviews.Author: nursegirl61
Reviews.Content: thousand hills in branson is the perfect place to get away from it all while up in branson. the front desk staff is so courteous and helpful, all you have to do is show up! beautiful condos amongst the golf course and rolling hills is so peaceful and quiet. we loved having so much room to spread out, and everything we could think of was provided for us. what we liked best about staying here is that while it seemed we were away from it all, we were still so close to all the attractions, restaurants and fun things to do while in branson. the indoor pool was great for the kids, and relaxing for us as well. overall, our stay in branson at thousand hills resort couldn't be beat, if only we could have stayed a little longer! we definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful cabin”
Reviews.Author: kiwibsr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cabin at Thousand Hills Resort, it was fairly secluded feeling, yet still very close to Tanger Outlet and the "strip". The cabin was absolutely beautiful, bed was comfy, washer/dryer in the cabin and even a 2 person jacuzzi tub. Lovely place, and we will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Looks like a cabin but, more like a condo.”
Reviews.Author: Fravel
Reviews.Content: These cabins are not individual dwellings. Ours had three units in our building. Not as private as a single cabin. They are located next to the tanger outlet mall if you like shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! The Majestic Lakefront condos managed by Thousand Hills”
Reviews.Author: elholtzman
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the new Majestic condos overlooking Tablerock Lake and had a terrific experience. We chose the Majestic because we wanted a more upscale lakefront option and, having previously stayed at the Thousand Hills Golf Resort condos, we knew we could expect something nice. (FYI - YOU CHECK IN AT THOUSAND HILLS GOLF RESORT in case you are having trouble finding the address to the Majestic.) The units were way beyond what we had hoped for from the photos and video! We had a stunning and super clean (I am very picky) four bedroom for the [older!] adults and a two bedroom in the next building for the young adults. It worked out perfectly! Both condos were spacious, had gorgeous kitchens with granite counters, stainless appliances and plenty of nice dishes, serving pieces, etc. Plenty of towels in each bath (one bath for each bedroom - nice!) Brazillian wood floors I would love to have in my home! Lots of extra pillows, too. The four bdrm on the top floor (unit 408) had a spacious balcony with lots of seating and and a screened in sun porch with beautiful apholstered furniture and a gas fireplace! Of course we turned it into a bunk room with air matresses for three girls, creating a 5th bdrm, so we didn't get to enjoy it - but we had plenty of room. The 2 bdrm (unit 112) had really nice carpet throughout and a small patio on the ground floor that looked right at bushes and the lake. Both units had a pullout queen in the living room. Thousand Hills was great about the reservations and check in, and we did have maintenance come a couple times to fix a squeaky bed, but they were very responsive and pleasant. You also have access to all the ammenities at Thousand Hills Golf Resort - golf discounts and fitness center/pools if you want to go there for a day. WHAT YOU'LL GET: a view of the lake, but there is some construction to look past if you are on the top floor. You'll look right at The Chateau on the Lake and their marina and some power lines - so it's not completely unobstructed. You can walk to the pool (very nice, but not enough lounge chairs...then again we were 19 people over the weekend so we sort of took it over!). Drive down to the dock for swimming and boating. The dock is the best part! It's brand new, really clean - not even any algea growing. We are used to Lake of the Ozarks, so we could not get over how CLEAN this lake is!!! TIP: if you plan to rent a boat during the summer - make advance reservations. My brothers wanted to wait until we got there and see which days to rent - and eveyone was booked! The State Park marina is close by, but their boats and wave runners went first. We had to drive 30 minutes away to rent a ski boat on two different days. POSITIVES: 1) great setting - brand new. Quiet - we were probably pretty loud at times with such a big group and had no complaints - and we never heard anyone else outside or through the walls. 2) on the lake (as much as you can be at Tablerock), but close enough to 76 (albeit some hilly, zig zag roads). 3) deluxe accomodations...from the leather furniture to the granite and really, really nice decor, free wireless...really top notch. 4) boat dock and pool - very clean, new and sparkly NEGATIVES... a small laundry list of less than perfect things about the Majestic: 1) no recycling bin...some of our teens were heartbroken about the number of plastic bottles and cans we threw in the dumpster...does no one in Branson recycle? 2) only about six lounge chairs at the pool...about 10 or so regular chairs. 3) they advertised grills by the pool - however these are two, tiny grills in a patch of grass at the bottom of the hill behind the pool. We made the most of it by driving down, setting up chairs and a cooler and having our own little party - just looked kind of weird basically grilling in a parking lot. The first floor units have access to grills out their patios. 4) the 4 bdrm condo had a fourth bedroom by the front door (unfortunately ours since we got last pick!) that is basically a closet with a king size sleigh bed. We can't figure out for the life of us how they got that bed in there! I hit my head every day on the small flatscreen tv mounted on the wall. There is no dresser, just a tiny nightstand, so we lived out of a suitcase for a week that was crammed in a closet that you had to climb into to use - there was about 10" space between the bed and the closet and bathroom. Only one person at a time could pass through (impossible for my two daughters and I to get ready at the same time) and you couldn't even open the door without slamming into the bed. I came home with some nice bruises from the giant footboard you basically had to climb over to get to the closet). It was a little claustrophobic for my 6' 5" husband and me. 5) the big condo could have used better cookware - only one medium/large pot and a 10" aluminum pan with no handle. I didn't find a non-stick pan until our last day there! But we made some major meals (other families might have eaten out more or made sandwiches - not this crowd!) 6) the elevator was broken on Saturday, which was surely a bummer for folks moving in, but fixed by Sunday when we left. 7) maintence came twice to fix a broken bed in the upstairs/loft bedroom. We were underneath it - so it kept two couples awake everytime they rolled over or moved at all! They tried WD40 first, but it came back since it was a wood frame. We convinced maintenace to show up with screws and a drill and it was fixed for the remainder of our stay. They were very nice about it! 8) no fitness center but you can get a quite a workout walking to the dock (which will be uphill ALL the way back!) Check out Thousand Hills website and click on lakefront condos! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Spot close to main highway”
Reviews.Author: loves_travelling2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the cabins in town. It was our second trip to Branson. I would definitely stay here again if we return. The ease getting onto the strip and to shows was one plus. We stayed in the one bedroom cabin and found it very quiet. The cabin is decorated for the area and very comfortable and romantic. The amenities are nice! It cost more than some hotels, but well worth it! You won't regret paying the extra for the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LondonLeader
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in a one-bedroom condo and were very pleased with the accommodations and the price. The condo was clean and well appointed, and although it was conveniently located near many attractions, it was still quiet. Our unit had a balcony and jacuzzi. The staff was very helpful and responsive--quickly answered my e-mails. Classy operation--and an excellent golf course, too! We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean facility”
Reviews.Author: lafolks
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the cabins of grand mountain! When we first arrived, we was greeted by a very friendly gentleman. He gave us wonderful instructions and was very helpful. As we arrived at our cabin, we was very impressed with room and cleanliness. The cabins were in a great, convenient location. We also experienced comfortable beds, tv in every room. All area attractions are close by and easy to get to from the cabins. We would recommend this cabin to anyone whether it is a family with teenagers, young children, or large groups. Thanks for a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place But,”
Reviews.Author: techfan10
Reviews.Content: Thousand Hills is a great place we stayed in the cabins the location is wonderful and close while you feel like you are in the woods you can walk to a outlet mall the only negatives I have to say is that there was a VCR no DVD I mean who has a VCR anymore we bought a cheap DVD player at Wal-Mart and left it for 19.99 I'm sure housekeeping got it but if not the next family hopefully enjoyed it and the secons is THE IR A\C thermostat I mean it was 90-95 degrees and 80 in the cabin when we got back it never got below 76 it was cooler outside I suggest for 200.00 for a cabin anight and higher that you should be able to have your room comfortable I understand the Green Movement but when your room is 85 degreees and you get back at 11:00 at night the poor A\C unit can never catch up with the heat form outside on a scale 1-10 I would say 7 a 10 without the I\R A\C

Reviews.Title: “Wish I lived closer, so I could come more often.”
Reviews.Author: handkeswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their 2 bedroom cabins. It was amazing. Jetted tub in the master, spotlessly clean, very comfortable furniture throughout. Love the fact that you have a full sized kitchen and that it has everything you need to fix a meal, minus the food of course. Very quiet, restful. Is only one block away from the main drag here in Branson, but you could hear the crickets chirping outside, not the traffic. Didn't try the indoor pool, but the fact that there was one was a big plus in my book. Book 2 nights in a 2 bedroom cabin and you get a booklet of coupons for the local shows and shops too. This is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo in Great Location - A Good Choice If You Want a Quiet Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: STLTraveler93
Reviews.Content: This condo was a great choice for my family, which didn’t require a lot service and on-location amenities. The condo was very clean with good amount of space. The enclosed patio was comfortable and quiet. The location was great, it as quiet and almost no traffic. But it was a short drive to the strip. Being located on the yellow route made it easy to get to most of our activities.

Reviews.Title: “best kept condos!”
Reviews.Author: luvtripsl
Reviews.Content: These are some of the best kept condos I've ever stayed in. I stayed in a unit that was 10 years old and it was super clean, very comfortable and the kitchens looked new/hardly used. It's right off the main strip but not so close that you hear all of the traffic. I would highly recommend these condos to anyone and would love to stay here again! The staff was friendly and helpful and sent me on my way with some delicious warm freshly baked cookies! No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “These cabins are awesome!”
Reviews.Author: lizann104
Reviews.Content: We vacationed in Branson a couple of weeks ago and stayed at the Cabins as Grand Mountain which are part of the Thousand Hills Golf Resort. Our cabin literally was the highpoint of our trip. I'd never been to Branson before and was somewhat underwhelmed by the town itself. However, I absolutely loved our cabin. We rented a two bedroom, two bath cabin and there was so much space. Our adult daughter loved her room with it's own bath and vanity. With her room located upstairs and ours downstairs, everyone felt they had plenty of privacy. The full kitchen lent itself beautifully to our need for flexibility with breakfast (everyone has different preferences for that meal in terms of quantity and timing). The livingroom with the fireplace was my favorite spot, though the enclosed deck would have been if it hadn't been a bit chilly when we were there. The cabin was very clean. While I was not all that thrilled with Branson itself, I would make the trip just to stay in that cabin. Very, very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Get Away”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLowOK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a romantic get away. They suggested the honeymoon cabin and it was perfect! The service was excellent and the cabin was more than we expected! Absolutely wonderful for a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Condo very nice - not very family friendly location”
Reviews.Author: CliquoteFisher
Reviews.Content: The condo we stayed in was very nice and comfortable. It had a lot of room for my 3 year old to play and the bed was very comfortable. My family and I took advantage of the full kitchen by preparing and eating a lot of our meals in the condo. If we were going to stay again and do the condo thing - I would do it when there wasn't much need for a pool, hot tub, or front desk help. We had to drive to the clubhouse to get pool towels. We had to drive to get to the indoor pool. The indoor pool was as cold as the outdoor pools while it was raining. When then drove back across the property to a hot tub that was situated away from everything but in the back yard of all the condo balconies and the road. There is no privacy for resting in the hot tub. Anytime we needed something that wasn't in in our room (extra trash bags) we had to drive to the club house to get it. We had a very good time in Branson, but we will probably go back to staying in a hotel instead of the condos. It is nice to have everything available to you at your fingertips rather than spending the gas to drive all over a condo resort.

Reviews.Title: “Save your cabin experience for Gatlinburg, TN”
Reviews.Author: floridaorbust
Reviews.Content: First of all, I hate being called a liar. Second, I hate crooks. I made my reservation with Megan for a 2 bedroom cabin and she told me that I would get the "special" rate of $169 per night. I booked the cabin for 2 nights with the grand total quoted as $378.90. Done. Okay, Friday night we arrive and at check-in were told we had been reserved a 2 bedroom condo. The gentleman explained that "she", whoever "she" was, had gone in and changed our reservation because something was "wrong" with the cabin that Megan had originally reserved. After working all week and driving 200+ miles to have a nice stay AND agreeing to spend that kind of money, the last thing you want to hear is that your reservation is not available. We finally got what we reserved. Unfortunately, that was not the end of our battles at the front desk. On Sunday, at check-out time, an extra $34 per night was added to our bill. When I inquired about the extra charge, I was told "she" added it but was given no explanation why? I reminded the gentleman at the front desk of our original quoted rate which was the same rate we agreed to at check-in. He didn't want to take me for my word, so I had to go back to my car and retrieve the original quote I had been emailed after I made the reservation. I'm not sure what crazy nonsense is going to show up on my credit card statement, but if you insist on staying at this facility, make sure and keep all your original price quotes and emails. The cabin itself was nice, but not secluded or quiet like you find in Gatlinburg, Tennessee. We have been to Branson many times and there are way too many accommodation choices in this town to have to be treated like we were treated at Thousand Hills Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cabin!”
Reviews.Author: SammySushi
Reviews.Content: We rented a 4 bedroom cabin with my brother in-law over the 4th of July weekend. The beds were HUGE (Cal Kings) and very comfortable. I think there was only 1 bed that was a Queen and there was a Cal King in the loft. We had 11 of us sleeping comfortably in the cabin. It was more pricey than we would normally spend, but well worth it. The teenagers thought the place was fantastic and I know it will be one of the vacations they look back on with great memories just because of the place we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better than this!!!”
Reviews.Author: Polargirl151
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. So close to route 79 and covenient to everything. A beautiful quiet wooded setting with an outside pool a short walking distance away. Indoor pool was a very short drive. Two bedrooms, 2 baths, living room, dining room and fully equipped kitchen. Television in each of the bedrooms and television, VCR, DVD, WIFI in livingroom. Bathrooms both had rainfall shower heads and one also had a jacuzzi tub. Imported Gilchrist & Soams shampoo, conditioner and bath soap was provided. Very nice touch! Beautiful gas fireplace in the living room. The kitchen had dish liquid, dish washer soap and extra garbage bags. They even supplied packages of coffee, sweetner and powdered creamer. Extra blanket, pillows and towels were also there if needed. The California king sized beds were so comfortable that none of had any complaints or backaches in the morning. The screened in porch was an unexpected addition and we spent lovely evenings out there. Great for family get togethers, friends or couples. We stayed there 7 nights. The front desk staff were always very friendly and helpful. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Twoearlybirds
Reviews.Content: My husband's immediate family just spent a three day weekend at Thousand Hills Golf Resort and I was inspired to write about the beautiful condo we rented. The four families that gathered to celebrate his father's 85th birthday each had their own room with bath. Two patios, one aimed at winter vacations and the other summer, afforded us breathtaking views of the lake! The kitchen and living room allowed us to eat in if desired and made us feel so homey as we gathered to reminisce about old times as if we were sitting in our own homes. All the rooms were beautifully decorated and everything we needed to live comfortably was provided. The beds were comfortable and everyone commented on how well they slept and how quiet the countryside setting was! Four families, all agreeing that the weekend was perfect and that the comfort of the condo was at the top of the list was why I wrote! We would recommend Thousand Hills as the perfect place to stay while in Branson. It might even be the reason to come to Branson!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cabin was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: grampers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took my parents to Branson for a few days' vacation and we stayed in a two-bedroom, two-bath cabin. The furnishings were beautiful, location was great, and we plan to definitely stay here on any future visits to Branson. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: arow97
Reviews.Content: As a delayed honeymoon, my husband and I stayed a week at the Cabins at Grand Mountain and it wasn't long enough! I was not ready to go home! The cabins were beautiful and relaxing. They were perfectly located. I felt so secluded while at the same time we were able to walk straight to the strip and all the attractions we wanted to go to (which was great considering the traffic on 76!). Speaking of traffic, the front desk was amazing when we checked in. They gave us all the information we needed, including a map, highlighted with alternate routes so as to avoid 76. The cabins were also nestled between two outlet centers, perfect for a shopper like me! When we didn't feel like going out, the cabin was provided with everything we needed to entertain ourselves: a full kitchen, stocked with dishes and cooking tools, to prepare our own meals, a gas fireplace, DVD player, wireless internet and hot tub. It was the most relaxing vacation I've ever had and I wouldn't trade the experience for anything. Next time we have the money, we're going straight there. The Cabins on Grand Mountain made a Branson lover out of me!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the log cabin”
Reviews.Author: nanof6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Thousand Hills Log Cabins for 5 nights, it was one of the best vacations we have had. the cabins were every thing they said they would be. Close to everything, including, shows, & shopping. They gave everything I requested, plus more!! Thank you for making this a very special vacation. i would stay there again for sure. Especially if I got the same cabin. It was fantastic. Thanks too you all- thousand Hills Resort, a great place to stay. The Wallace family from Maine

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cabin, front desk not helpful”
Reviews.Author: mofolk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Branson with his parents who were celebrating their 44th wedding anniversary. We loved the way the cabin was decorated and everything looked so nice. Each bedroom had it's own bathroom and I couldn't wait until later to take a shower because it looked so inviting. We checked in and left for the afternoon and evening. Upon returning we had some snacks so I washed the dishes before bed. I woke at 5:00 am to use the restroom and noticed that the toilet did not refill with water. I went to the sink and discovered we did not have any water. Since it was 5:00 am I returned to bed and woke again at 7:30. I went to the kitchen to make coffee only to discover we still had no running water. My husband called the front desk to find out what was going on and we were told that none of the cabins had water and the city was working on it. He asked if they were going to discount the cabin or give us a voucher for another nights stay since we couldn't even clean up to check out. We were infomred that this was out of their control and they would not be doing anything. In my opinion this is when you get to see a businesses true colors. They could have been very apologetic, they maybe could have brought water around for coffee making or even maybe some coffee. My mother-in-law called the front desk to speak to the manager because she had put the cabin on her credit card and explained that part of the amenities we had paid for we were not receiving. The manager said she would see what she could do and call us back. The water did come back on about 9:45 which left the 4 of us just enough time to shower and check out by 11:00. The manager never called back. I have stayed at Thousand Hills several other times before but had never had a problem until now and I didn't think they handled it well at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Escape in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: Smith07
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a short trip to Branson where we stayed in The Cabins at Thousand Hills Resort. I was surprised to find that the cabins are right in the middle of Branson, but surrounded by trees and had an away from it all feel. Our 2 room cabin was beautifully decorated and had all the amenities of home (spa tub, rain shower, multiple tvs). I honestly felt that we could be in a cabin in Montana and all that was missing was the snow. On the down side.....if you have small children, the pool is very small and there are no playground type areas....the cabins are about 6 blocks away from the main resort and you have to cross HWY 76 ( a nightmare) . We had key trouble one night and it was about 40 minutes round trip to fix the problem. ...that being said, I would recommend the cabins and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Take a look at your condo before you go about the day”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-Travel-501
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Thousand Hills many times and loved it but this past time we checked in but then went on to silver dollar for the day and didnt return to the room until late. Our daughter was asleep so we put her to bed and then when we started looking around the place was nasty. The carpet was dirty, the bath tub had caulking coming off and hair stuck to the jets in the tub and it had not been used by us. When we went to pull out the sleeper sofa it was awful there was what seemed to be blood stains all over the mattress so we folded it right back up and called the front desk they did offer to try and find another condo but it was 11:30 and our 2 year old asleep we decided to make do until morning, they offered a 10% discount which I laughed at considering the price we had paid and the condition it was in. The furniture looked like something out of the cheapest hotel you could ever stay in. We checked out and I called the manager when we returned home and she was very kind and appologinic and refunded our stay 100 %. I will probably stay here again but will go check things out as soon as I check in.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great cabin!”
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed three nights in Branson at a cabin just north of the strip. Descriptions given before us have been accurate. Open floor plan, full size kitchen appliances, wonderful bed. Loved the rain showerheads and the washer-dryer set in the bathroom. We didn't walk much in Dec. but you probably could get to some shops and shows on foot. It was easy to connect to the Blue Route by car and then get nearly everywhere. At the check-in desk, we received some great tips on getting around the town without making too many left turns. The main route is being widened to five lanes...supposed to be finished in 2007. In the meantime, use the alternate routes.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Tulsa
Reviews.Content: What a cool place to stay. My family and I stayed at Thousand Hills recently and I was so impressed. Our condo overlooked the golf course, and unfortunately I was in town on business and not able to play. Our 2 bedroom condo was the nicest I've stayed in yet and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not told”
Reviews.Author: GPRM
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom log cabin which was very nice, even though the fireplace did not work. But what was very disappointing was the construstion noise!!!! Cabins are still being built and every morning we were woke up at 7:30 by the noise! I feel we should have been told when making our reservations about that. We could of made an informed choice, I feel we were mislead. GPRM from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Condo Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lovebranson
Reviews.Content: We were in a great and beautiful condo. There were five family members. We had three bedrooms and baths. It was a really nice comfortable condo. We plan to return soon. I had cotact with a very nice man that helped make or arrangements. His name is Dobe. Everyone was real nice and helpful that we had contact with during our stay. We loved the grounds and the location. Very easy to get to shows, shops etc. We all are very pleased and hope to return in the near future. BevAvey

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinQueen
Reviews.Content: The cabins are nice; however, regardless of what the website says the ammenities are, there is NO swimming pool available as of today. There is a tiny pool that is under construction. We were told that it is not Thousand Hills' fault that "we assumed" there would be a pool, and we were welcome to use one of the condominium pools (which have no lounge chairs or restroom facilities and are located quite a way from the cabins, certainly not within walking distance). We responded by saying that the website lists a swimming pool first on the list of ammenities; management responded that there had been a few problems about this and they had discussed changing the website but that would put them over the word allowance and would cost too much money. As I stated earlier, the cabins are nice--Just be aware that this company's business is to sell property and therefore is not concerned with any needs of those who rent the cabins.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Branson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have tried a few places in and around Branson, mostly in the Kimberling City area because we wanted to get away from the noise of HWY 76. We found just the place in Branson, and it's actually right in the middle. The Cabins at Grand Mountain, which is part of the Thousand Hills resort are what we would consider 4 star accomidations at budget prices for what you get. We stayed in one of the brand new 2 bedroom, 2 bath cabins. Vaulted cealings, fully equipped kithens, waterfall shower with dual heads for each bedroom and the master bedroom also has a big jacuzzi tub for two. The fireplace is an automatic gasser with just a flick of a switch. The big screened in back porch is what sold me. Great place to go and not get eaten by the local skeeters. These cabins have tiled floors, washer and dryer, high speed cable internet and are just 5 minutes from the red topped 90 outlet shops and the new Tanger outlet mall. It was easy to get to wallmart and a nice grocery store, also 5 minutes away and all the best shows are also just minutes away. Now we donlt have to stay in Kimberling to get quiet and also we don't have that 20 minute drive to get to shopping and shows in Branson. If you want to stay someplace nice and split the cost with family or another couple, the Cabins at Grand Mountain is one of the best deals going.

Reviews.Title: “Great '4-star-quality' condo to relax in comfort with your family.”
Reviews.Author: WSADJA
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a 3-night stay with our family in this 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo. We stayed in the Legacy Building #5. Our unit included: full kitchen (full-size frig. and a microwave)with EVERYTHING you'd want in a kitchen except the food. There's a grocery store 5 minutes away (near McDonalds on HWY 76), so I had the groceries bought and away in a short time ...and made cookies. The enclosed, heated pool was in a stand alone building across the parking lot with it's own parking lot. A large jacuzzi tub in the master bath. All rooms in this unit are spacious, especially the master bedroom. Beds are Marriott beds and everyone in my group said "GOOD BEDS!" Washer and dryer upright unit was appreciated too! Total unit is 1500 sq. ft or better. If you know Branson, these units are about two blocks SW of the Grand Palace, walking distine if you're young and healthy ... and it's warm and dry enough. We were there on a timeshare presentation, but the units they were selling were at a different resort with noticeably smaller rooms. Note: a newer airline servicing the area has lots of $89 each-way specials: to Florida, to California, etc. (per a local). Also, these condo's have a screened-in back porch that back up to the golf course. Our unit was on the lowest level. A (second) family-size table is out on the back porch. This could be lovely on warm, breezy days, or for playing games with the family. There is a large TV in the great room area, and two medium size TVs in the bedrooms. We would suggest one minor improvement, to have a DVD player - at least in the great room. We happened to have a laptop with us that we networked to be our DVD player (to the TV jack). The TVs in the unit may have been put there by the condo owner(s) - not sure. These are timeshare units being rented-out, so you make your own bed and do your own dishes. THe owner of our unit left a book of discount coupons for Branson shows and attractions with a note that we were welcome to use it - a thoughful touch! We would stay in these units again if the price per night stays affordable. If you're bringing a family for several days, this would be a great place to feel comfortable. Relaxing is easy. It has a homey feel, and have everything that you need to prepare your own meals -if you like. P. S. - bring salt and pepper (although you have every kitchen appliance, etc. there are NO food items).

HotelInfo.Name: Thousand Hills Resort and Golf Club
HotelInfo.Address: 245 S. Wildwood, Branson, MO 65616
